com.hms_networks.americas.sc.time

Class LocalTimeOffsetCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hms_networks.americas.sc.time.LocalTimeOffsetCalculator

  • public class LocalTimeOffsetCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for calculating the offset between local time and UTC.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    HMS Networks, MU Americas Solution Center

        public static long getLocalTimeOffsetMilliseconds()

        time offset in milliseconds

      • calculateLocalTimeOffsetMilliseconds

        public static long calculateLocalTimeOffsetMilliseconds()
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        EWException,
                                                        java.text.ParseException
        Calculates the offset between UTC time and local time (in milliseconds) and stores the result to be returned by getLocalTimeOffsetMilliseconds(). The result is also returned by this method. The local time offset is calculated using an on-device HTML file that is accessed using the default Ewon username and password, or an updated username/password combination specified by calling setDeviceUsername(String) and setDevicePassword(String). The username/password combination must be updated to reflect a valid username/password combination on the Ewon Flexy device.
        Returns:
        calculated local time offset (in milliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read/write local time offset files
        EWException - if unable to create HTTP connection to local time offset HTML file (check device username and password)
        java.text.ParseException - if unable to parse local time offset result file

      • generateLocalTimeOffsetFiles

        private static void generateLocalTimeOffsetFiles()
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 EWException
        Generates a local time offset HTML files and creates an HTTP connection to that page to generate a local time offset result file. The HTTP connection is authenticated using the default Ewon device credentials, or updated device credentials that can be set via setDeviceUsername(String) and setDevicePassword(String).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to write local time offset HTML file
        EWException - if unable to create HTTP connection to local time offset HTML file (check device username and password)

      • parseOffsetFromLocalTime

        private static long parseOffsetFromLocalTime()
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             java.text.ParseException
        Parses and returns the value from the local time offset result file generated by generateLocalTimeOffsetFiles().
        Returns:
        local time offset
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read local time offset result file
        java.text.ParseException - if unable to parse local time offset result file
